result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Santiago

records.addlTxt: Payment plan set up for court appointed attorney fees. Payment plan due date summary mailed to defendant.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:44 AM Defendant David A Santiago in court.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges/penalties and advises Defendant on right to an Attorney. Case recessed at 10:45 AM to allow Defendant to speak with Public Defender. Case recalled at 11:07 AM - same appearances. Defendant advises spoke with Public Defender and does not qualify for representation. Case recessed at 11:08 AM to allow Defendant time to complete Petition for Court Appointed Attorney Form. Case recalled at 11:20 AM - same appearances. Defendant files Petition. Court examines Defendant, finds him indigent and will appoint at Attorney to the case. Attorney Tanz appearing in person, in court, advises will represent the Defendant. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint. Counsel requesting status hearing. Court finds good cause to waive time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Sheriff's Dept advises bond was posted on 9/16/2022.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No THC products or ectasy.

11:21 AM Defendant David A Santiago appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran, appearing as friend of the Court. Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of compliant, defendant will retain Atty. Mindy Nolan, does not qualify for PD. State recommends $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Court orders $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court finds good cause for extending time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
